Package ktt.lib.httpserver

Class SimpleHttpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ktt.lib.httpserver.SimpleHttpServer
  • public abstract class SimpleHttpServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a simplified implementation of HttpServer.
    At least one HttpHandler must be created in order to process requests. When handling requests the server will use the most specific context. If no handler can be found it is rejected with a 404 response.
    Contexts are case-sensitive.
    Since:
    02.00.00
    Version:
    02.00.00
    Author:
    Ktt Development
    See Also:
    HttpServer, HttpHandler, SimpleHttpHandler

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext()
        Creates a temporary context at a random address that will remove itself after the first connection. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        To get the context use HttpContext.getPath().
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, createTemporaryContext(long), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler, long), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler, long), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext​(long maxTime)
        Creates a temporary context at a random address that will remove itself after the first connection or after the max time is passed. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        To get the context use HttpContext.getPath().
        Parameters:
        maxTime - the maximum time the context may exist for (in milliseconds)
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, createTemporaryContext(), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler, long), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler, long), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext​(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler handler)
        Creates a temporary context at a random address that will remove itself after the first connection. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        To get the context use HttpContext.getPath().
        This method encapsulates the handler with a temporary one, so HttpContext.getHandler() will not return the one passed in the parameter, instead it will return the encapsulating handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler to use
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, HttpHandler, createTemporaryContext(), createTemporaryContext(long), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler, long), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler, long), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext​(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler handler,
                                                                          long maxTime)
        Creates a temporary context at a random address that will remove itself after the first connection or after the max time is passed. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        To get the context use HttpContext.getPath().
        This method encapsulates the handler with a temporary one, so HttpContext.getHandler() will not return the one passed in the parameter, instead it will return the encapsulating handler.
        Parameters:
        handler - handler to use
        maxTime - the maximum time the context may exist for (in milliseconds)
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, HttpHandler, createTemporaryContext(), createTemporaryContext(long), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler, long), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext​(java.lang.String context,
                                                                          com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler handler)
        Creates a temporary context at a specified address that will remove itself after the first connection. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        This method encapsulates the handler with a temporary one, so HttpContext.getHandler() will not return the one passed in the parameter, instead it will return the encapsulating handler.
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        handler - handler to use
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the context is invalid or taken
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the context is null
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, HttpHandler, createTemporaryContext(), createTemporaryContext(long), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler, long), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler, long), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)

      • createTemporaryContext

        public abstract com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpContext createTemporaryContext​(java.lang.String context,
                                                                          com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler handler,
                                                                          long maxTime)
        Creates a temporary context at a random address that will remove itself after the first connection or after the max time is passed. This type of context is typically used for single use downloads or media file hosting.
        To get the context use HttpContext.getPath().
        This method encapsulates the handler with a temporary one, so HttpContext.getHandler() will not return the one passed in the parameter, instead it will return the encapsulating handler.
        Parameters:
        context - the context
        handler - handler to use
        maxTime - the maximum time the context may exist for (in milliseconds)
        Returns:
        the http context associated with the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the context is invalid or taken
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the context is null
        Since:
        02.00.00
        See Also:
        HttpContext, HttpHandler, createTemporaryContext(), createTemporaryContext(long), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler), createTemporaryContext(HttpHandler, long), createTemporaryContext(String), createTemporaryContext(String, long), createTemporaryContext(String, HttpHandler), removeContext(String), removeContext(HttpContext)
